title: India's first female racing champion Alisha Abdullah joins BJP
description: Indian bike and car racing champion Alisha Abdullah joined the BJP in Chennai on Saturday. BJP's Tamil Nadu President K Annamalai was present in the event. "I am very happy to welcome a true sporting icon and fabulous competitive racer today," Annamalai said. Alisha is the country's first female national racing champion.

title: Karan Johar and Rajamouli have united the Indian film industry: Jr NTR
description: Actor Jr NTR, during the promotional event for 'Brahmastra' in Hyderabad, said that Karan Johar and SS Rajamouli have united the Indian film industry. "Let us hope...Karan sir achieves yet another milestone with this movie," he added. Karan Johar is producing the upcoming film. Jr NTR further said he hopes "Brahmastra emerges as the Brahmastra of our Indian film industry".

title: Armed groups clash in Libyan capital
description: Armed factions in Libya fought on the outskirts of Tripoli on early Saturday as groups close to Abdulhamid al-Dbeibah's government consolidated their position. The violence took place in Warshafala which has seen regular clashes in the last 11 years since a NATO-supported movement ousted veteran leader Muammar Gaddafi. Presently, Dbeibah's rival Fathi Bashagha has support in the country's east.

title: Thousands attend Gorbachev's farewell in Moscow; Putin absent
description: Thousands of mourners attended late former Soviet leader Mikhail Gorbachev's farewell ceremony in Moscow on Saturday. Later, Gorbachev, who died at the age of 91 earlier in the week, was buried next to his wife Raisa at Novodevichy Cemetery. Putin was absent from the farewell and was said to be travelling to Russia's westernmost exclave, Kaliningrad on the day.

title: Zimbabwe's Sikandar Raza criticises commentators for calling Maxwell's dismissal 'lucky'
description: After Zimbabwe defeated Australia by three wickets on Saturday to record their first-ever ODI victory against Australia in Australia, Zimbabwe batter Sikandar Raza criticised commentators for calling Glenn Maxwell's dismissal "lucky". "It was a lucky one, he knows how lucky it was," a commentator said. Sharing the video, Sikandar wrote, "How's this a lucky one...Please someone help me out here."

title: I almost died in that event: Serena on French Open 2015 win being her proudest achievement
description: On being asked about the proudest achievement of her career, Serena Williams said, "[Winning] French Open 2015." She added, "That's definitely the one that I'm taking with me because I almost died in that event. Somehow I won. So that was pretty awesome." Serena was suffering from flu during the tournament and played with a 101-degree fever in the semi-final.

title: What is non-Hodgkin's lymphoma that has affected actress Jane Fonda?
description: Actress Jane Fonda has shared that she has been diagnosed with non-Hodgkin lymphoma. Non-Hodgkin lymphoma is a type of cancer that forms in the lymph system. It begins when a type of white blood cell, called a T cell or B cell, becomes abnormal. The signs and symptoms include swollen lymph nodes, fever, drenching night sweats, weight loss and fatigue.

title: Sharmila never received criticism for Mansoor's underperformance: Mumtaz
description: Veteran actress Mumtaz reacted to the hatred that the wives and girlfriends of cricketers receive when they fail to perform on the field. She said her contemporaries Sharmila Tagore and Reena Roy never received criticism if Mansoor Ali Khan Pataudi and Mohsin Khan underperformed. "Why are Bollywood actresses never praised when their cricketer-husband or boyfriends do well on...field?" said Mumtaz.

title: Deoghar DC charged with sedition on MP's complaint over airport row
description: A Zero FIR has been registered by Delhi Police against Deoghar Deputy Commissioner (DC) Manjunath Bhajantri on various charges including sedition on a complaint by BJP MP Nishikant Dubey. This comes after Dubey and nine others, including BJP MP Manoj Tiwari, were booked by Jharkhand Police for allegedly barging into Deoghar airport's air traffic control (ATC) room earlier this week.

title: Mahesh Babu's daughter makes 1st television appearance, actor pens note
description: Mahesh Babu on Saturday penned a note for his daughter Sitara on Instagram as she made her first television appearance. Mahesh and Sitara appeared together on 'Dance India Dance Telugu'. He wrote, "Sitara's first time on television...and our first appearance together...couldn't be more special! Watching her interact with everyone and dance...with such confidence...was a moment of pride for me!"

title: Rizwan going back not out was big no; what's the point of it in T20: Wasim
description: After Pakistani opener Muhammad Rizwan scored 78*(57) against Hong Kong, former pacer Wasim Akram said that Rizwan "going back not out" to him "was a big no". "If you are tired, try to hit boundaries and maybe get out and try and get fresh legs in the middle...What is the point in this format (T20) going not out," Akram asked.

title: Obesity, psychological problems linked to excessive screen time: Study
description: Excessive screen time can cause obesity and psychological problems in people, a study stated. "Excessive exposure to blue light from...TVs, laptops and phones may have detrimental effects on a wide range of cells in our body, from skin and fat cells to sensory neurons," a researcher said. "[Avoiding]...excessive blue light exposure may be a good anti-ageing strategy," he added.

title: Govt school PTI booked for sexually harassing girl students in Rajasthan
description: A Physical Training Instructor (PTI) of Kendriya Vidyalaya school in Rajasthan's Jodhpur has been booked for sexual harassment and indecent behaviour with girl students. At least 12 girls aged between 15-17 years have alleged that the accused used to call them on phone and force them to have obscene talks with him. The girls had complained to the school management.

title: Appalled by unruly conduct of FM Sitharaman with Collector: KTR
description: After Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman questioned Kamareddy District Collector Jitesh Patil over the absence of PM Narendra Modi's pictures at fair price shops, Telangana minister KT Rama Rao said, "I am appalled by [Sitharaman's] unruly conduct." He also complimented Patil on his "dignified conduct", adding, "These political histrionics...will only demoralise hardworking AIS officers."

title: EU well-prepared in case Russia ceases gas supply: EU official
description: The European Union is "well-prepared" to face the eventuality of a total halt in gas supply by Russia, thanks to storage capacity and energy-saving measures, EU's Economic Commissioner said on Saturday. Notably, Russian state-run gas company Gazprom on Friday announced that gas supply via the Nord Stream 1 pipeline to Germany would remain suspended indefinitely due to technical reasons.

title: Iran says it has equipped 51 cities with civil defence systems
description: Iran's Defence Ministry on Saturday said that 51 cities in the country have been equipped with civil defence systems to prevent any possible foreign attacks. The systems enable authorities to "identify and monitor threats by using round-the-clock software, according to the type of the threat and risk", Deputy Defence Minister General Mahdi Farahi said, as per the local media.

title: Shah directs Ahmedabad civic body to solve garbage disposal issues in 3 days
description: Union Home Minister Amit Shah has directed the Amdavad Municipal Corporation (AMC) to resolve the issue of garbage disposal in the localities of Bopal, Ghuma and Ambli within three days. Shah has asked Municipal Commissioner Lochan Sehra to resolve the issue, which has emerged due to a strike by sanitation workers, BJP's Gujarat unit said.

title: 3 killed, 5 injured in lightning strike in MP's Singrauli
description: Three persons were killed and five others were injured due to a lightning strike on Saturday in Madhya Pradesh's Singrauli, police said. Out of the five injured persons, the condition of two women was critical, an official said. The deceased were identified as 55-year-old Shyam Lal Kol, 52-year-old Meru Prasad Saket and 40-year-old Laxman Prasad Kol, Inspector Anil Upadhyay said.

title: Dynasty politics by Cong caused great loss to country: BJP leader
description: BJP leader Prakash Javadekar on Saturday criticised Congress and said the dynasty politics by the party has caused great loss to the country. "Look at our party, be it PM Modi and other leaders...from where did they come," Javadekar said at a programme in Jaipur. "They came from ordinary families with no political background, muscle or money power," he added.

title: NIA searches 16 locations in Assam in ULFA recruitment case
description: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Friday conducted searches at 16 locations in Assam in connection with the United Liberation Front of Asom (ULFA) recruitment case and militant training in Myanmar. "Digital devices, live ammunition...incriminating documents and literature related to ULFA have been seized," the NIA stated. The investigations in the case are still in progress, NIA added.

title: Dravid avoids saying 'sexy' while answering during press conference, video goes viral
description: A video went viral showing India head coach Rahul Dravid avoiding saying the word 'sexy' during press conference. "I'm very confident that we've a very good bowling attack that produces results, might not be as, umm, I wanted to use a word but can't." After a journalist said if it is "exuberant", Dravid said, "No...It's four-letter word, starts with S."

title: Man hangs himself in Maha, mother jumps into well on seeing his body
description: A 26-year-old man named Shailesh Patil allegedly hanged himself from a tree near his house in Maharashtra's Palghar on Thursday. On seeing the son's dead body, his 40-year-old mother jumped into a well and ended her life, a police official said. The family conducted their last rites without informing police, the official said, adding that police are investigating the matter.

title: UK approves 2nd bivalent COVID-19 vaccine
description: Health authorities in the UK on Saturday approved the second "bivalent" vaccine which will be used as a booster dose to gain protection against the original strain of coronavirus and its Omicron variant. The jab can be given to individuals above 12 years of age. "Clinical trial...showed a strong immune response," said the Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency.

title: 'Modi-Modi' chanted as Gehlot visits temple in Raj; BJP shares video
description: A group of devotees chanted "Modi-Modi" as Rajasthan CM and Congress leader Ashok Gehlot visited a temple in Jaisalmer on Friday. Sharing a video of the incident, BJP state President Satish Poonia called it "trends for 2023 and 2024 elections". "Devotees were expressing their choice by raising slogans…Gehlot…was accepting the greetings by shaking hands," minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat tweeted.

title: 25-yr-old transgender man dies after attack in German pride parade
description: A 25-year-old transgender man has died after he was attacked at an LGBT+ Pride event in the west German city of Münster last week, police said. The news of Malte C's death triggered outrage with politicians and LGBT+ rights advocates demanding action. Reportedly, Malte was protecting a group of women from an attacker at the parade when he sustained injuries.

title: Rolls of Congress' internal elections not to be made public
description: Congress' Central Election Authority Chairman Madhusudan Mistry on Saturday said electoral rolls to elect the party's next president would not be made public. "No question of making it public," Mistry said. Earlier in the week, senior Congress leaders Shashi Tharoor, Anand Sharma, Manish Tewari, Pradyut Bordoloi and Karti Chidambaram said making the rolls public would ensure transparency.

title: Teesta Setalvad walks out of prison a day after SC grants her bail
description: Activist Teesta Setalvad walked out of Sabarmati Central Jail in Ahmedabad a day after the Supreme Court granted her interim bail in a case related to the 2002 Gujarat riots. Setalvad has been in jail since June 26 for allegedly fabricating evidence related to the riots. She has been let out on bail after furnishing a personal bond of ₹25,000.

title: Detergent allegedly used to cook mid-day meal in WB's Dinajpur
description: Several students of a school in West Bengal's Uttar Dinajpur reportedly fell ill and started vomiting after eating the mid-day meal on Friday. Local authorities said their investigation found that detergent or powdered soap was mixed with the meal instead of salt, leading to the incident. Protesting parents reportedly locked the headmaster and teachers inside an office.

title: NASA's Artemis 1 Moon rocket launch postponed again due to fuel leak
description: NASA's Artemis 1 Moon mission has been postponed again ahead of the rescheduled launch today. "Teams attempted to fix an issue related to a leak in the hardware transferring fuel into the rocket, but were unsuccessful," NASA stated. Earlier, its first launch attempt was called off on August 29 due to an issue with an engine bleed.

title: School principal kidnapped in Maharashtra; ₹30 lakh ransom sought
description: A 50-year-old school principal was allegedly kidnapped by unidentified persons in Maharashtra's Nagpur, who have demanded ₹30 lakh ransom for his release, police said on Saturday. His two-wheeler vehicle was found parked in front of a hospital, an officer said. Police have registered a case in this connection and have formed several teams to trace the victim.

title: Pak are laying a foundation too deep; unnecessary in T20s: Sanjay
description: Former India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar commented on the middle order of the Pakistan T20 side in the ongoing Asia Cup. "They (Pakistan) are laying too deep a foundation. For a 20-over innings, it's unnecessary," Manjrekar said. He added, "What's more it...[needs to] give more opportunity to number four, five [and] six, thereby making Pakistan a more wholesome batting unit."

title: Opposition will unify for 2024 elections: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar
description: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar called for Opposition's unity in 2024 elections and said there is a need to think about how BJP is allegedly poaching MLAs from other parties. "When we parted ways from the NDA, all our six Manipur MLAs came...and assured us they were with JDU," said Kumar. He further questioned the constitutionality of the alleged poaching.

title: Six debt-ridden farmers die by suicide within 24 hours in Vidarbha
description: Six debt-ridden farmers died by suicide in Maharashtra's Vidarbha region within a 24-hour period on Friday and Saturday. A state government body said the farmers' crops were ruined due to the unprecedented rains and they failed to get fresh loans to sow their fields. Vidarbha has seen the most farmer deaths by suicide in Maharashtra in the past two years.

title: 'RRR' actress Ahmareen Anjum ties the knot with actor Danny Sura, shares pics
description: Actress Ahmareen Anjum, who played a character named Loki in Rajamouli's 'RRR', tied the knot with actor Danny Sura in Kolkata on August 20. Taking to Instagram on Saturday, Ahmareen shared a series of pictures from her wedding ceremony and wrote, "Fortunate to have found my soulmate...We seek your love [and] blessings as we embark on this new journey together!"

title: Very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
description: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, has issued very heavy rainfall warning for several states. Very heavy rainfall is likely over some parts of Karnataka and Kerala on September 6 and 7. It is likely over Tamil Nadu and Puducherry on September 6. Parts of Arunachal Pradesh, West Bengal, Sikkim and Uttarakhand may witness very heavy rainfall tomorrow.

title: 48-year-old IVRI employee dies while dancing at birthday party in UP, video surfaces
description: Prabhat Kumar, a 48-year-old man working at Indian Veterinary Research Institute (IVRI) in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly, died while dancing at a birthday party. A video has surfaced on social media showing Prabhat performing a solo dance and suddenly collapsing mid-way. He was then rushed to a hospital, where the doctors declared him dead. He reportedly suffered a severe heart attack.

title: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar can never become PM in his life: BJP MP Sushil Modi
description: BJP Rajya Sabha MP Sushil Kumar Modi on Saturday said Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar can never become Prime Minister in his life. "Posters and hoardings don't make anyone the Prime Minister. If a leader only has 5-10 MPs from his party, how can he become...PM?" he said, adding Nitish broke alliance with NDA just to remain in news.

title: Sitharaman scolds Collector over no pic of PM at ration shop in T'gana, video surfaces
description: A video shows Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman scolding Kamareddy District Collector Jitesh Patil when he couldn't provide an answer to what the Centre and state's share was in the rice supplied through fair price shops. She also asked why PM Modi's picture was missing at a shop. "Our people will come and put up...PM's banner here," she told him.

title: We all knew you were the greatest: LeBron James on Serena Williams
description: Los Angeles Lakers forward LeBron James termed 23-time Grand Slam Champion Serena Williams as "unbelievable", adding he can speak about her journey for "an hour". "We all knew you were the greatest...It's been an honour to watch...you conquer all the goals...you ever set out, to see you break records," stated James. "What...you have done for women...is unprecedented," he said.

title: Johar touches Nagarjuna's feet at event, says 'Dad was a friend of Nag sir'
description: Filmmaker Karan Johar, during a promotional event for 'Brahmastra' in Hyderabad, touched the feet of Nagarjuna who also marked his presence along with Jr NTR and SS Rajamouli. "My father was a dear friend of Nag sir, and I feel that legacy of love continues," Johar said. He added that Nagarjuna was the "favourite person" on the sets of 'Brahmastra'.

title: 150-foot-wide asteroid to pass past the Earth today: NASA
description: A gigantic killer asteroid named 2022 QO31 is going to pass past the Earth on September 3, NASA said. The asteroid will pass from 5.3 million kilometres away from the Earth. However, if any last-minute deviation takes place, the 150-foot-wide asteroid can reach the Earth in two days. It is travelling at a speed of 30,420 kmph.

title: Ukraine's attempt to seize nuclear plant thwarted, claims Russia
description: Russia's Defence Ministry on Saturday claimed that its forces on Friday night thwarted the Ukrainian military's attempt to capture the Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant. Over 250 troops of Ukraine's Navy attempted a landing on the coast of a lake near the plant, the ministry said. Russian forces foiled the attack with strikes from military helicopters and fighter jets, it added.

title: 6, including lady gang leader, charged under Gangster Act in UP
description: Six people, including a lady gang leader along with her husband, have been booked under the Gangster Act in Mainpuri, UP. The police had recently arrested members of a robbery gang, which was headed by the female accused, identified as Vineeta, police said. Vineeta used to travel on e-rickshaws and intoxicate fellow travellers before stealing their belongings, police added.

title: 11-yr-old boy killed as wall collapses in UP's Bareilly
description: An 11-year-old boy, identified as Gaurav Kumar, was killed in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly on Saturday after a wall of his neighbour's house collapsed on him while he was playing, police said. Another boy was injured in the incident. Neighbours pulled the boys out of the debris and took them to a hospital where Gaurav was declared dead, the SP said.

title: Teacher, headmaster arrested for assaulting student in Rajasthan
description: A teacher and a headmaster of a private school in Rajasthan's Sikar have been arrested for allegedly assaulting a student. Police said the Class 12 student was allegedly slapped by his teacher for not following instructions to stand in line properly during a prayer meeting. Later, he was allegedly thrashed by both the accused, the victim's family claims.

title: Need to make educational institutions future ready: President Murmu
description: President Droupadi Murmu on Saturday said there is a need to make educational institutions future ready with new teaching and learning metrics, pedagogy and content. Addressing the closing ceremony of Diamond Jubilee celebrations of Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Delhi, President Murmu called IITs the country's pride and said, "Their story is the story of independent India."

title: If Kerala has a future, it's BJP: Amit Shah in Thiruvananthapuram
description: Addressing the southern zonal council meeting in Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram, Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday said if the state has a future, it's the BJP. "Congress is vanishing from the country, the world is getting rid of communist parties," Shah said. "Congress...and the Communists never worked for the welfare of the Scheduled Tribes and the poor," Shah added.

title: Afghanistan have all their bases covered, confidence is high: Jaffer
description: Former India batter Wasim Jaffer said that the Afghanistan team have "covered all their bases". "The [Afghanistan] batters are playing well, they have world-class spinners and the pacers have done well too," Jaffer said. He added, "So,...the confidence is high considering they defeated both their opponents [in the group stage]...Afghanistan is definitely the favourites to win [against Sri Lanka]."

title: British tourists charged ₹112 for using toilet at Agra railway station
description: Two British tourists were reportedly charged ₹112 each for using washroom in the executive lounge of the Agra Cantt railway station. The amount included 12% GST as well. As per reports, IRCTC clarified it's a mandatory fee charged by the executive lounge, after which a passenger can stay inside for two hours, use free wifi and also avail free coffee.

title: Minister came to hotel & stayed till 2 am, took voters to 1 floor: Bhutia on AIFF elections
description: After losing the AIFF elections to Kalyan Chaubey, ex-captain Bhaichung Bhutia said he was shocked as he didn't expect political interference of "high level". "If they (his opponents) were...confident...why a powerful Union Minister had to come at...hotel (where voters were staying)...and stay there till 2 am in...morning of election day...and take all of them to particular floor," Bhutia stated.

title: Dalit student hit with metal rod, broom for touching UP teacher's bike
description: A Class 6 Dalit student in Uttar Pradesh's Ballia was allegedly locked up in a classroom and beaten with a metal rod and a broom by his teacher for touching the latter's motorcycle, police said on Saturday. The other staff of the school rescued the boy, police added. According to a Basic Shiksha Adhikari, the accused teacher has been suspended.

title: Ravindra Jadeja's knee injury serious, set to miss T20 World Cup 2022: Reports
description: India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja is set to miss T20 World Cup 2022 as he'll undergo a knee surgery, reports said. "Jadeja's right knee injury is pretty serious. He's supposed to undergo a major knee surgery and will be out of action for indefinite period of time," a senior BCCI official told PTI. The T20 WC 2022 will begin next month.

title: Take steps to galvanise economy: Kerala CM to Centre
description: Speaking at the 30th southern zonal council meeting, chaired by Union Minister Amit Shah, Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan urged the Centre to enable the states to "undertake productive spending to galvanise the national economy". "The fiscal empowerment of the Union and the states are of equal importance to meet the long impact of the pandemic on the economy," he said.

title: Lakhs of people to attend rally against price rise: Cong leader Venugopal
description: Talking about 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', Congress MP KC Venugopal said they're (Congress) set for a massive rally against price rise which will be attended by lakhs of people. "This agitation started 2021 onwards, we can proudly say we are the party that's fighting against price rise in the country," he said. The Yatra will take place from Kanyakumari to Srinagar.

title: 18 killed in al-Shabaab attack in Somalia, food aid trucks burnt
description: At least 18 civilians were killed in an overnight attack by al-Shabaab militants in Somalia's central region, the country's state news agency reported on Saturday. The al-Shabaab fighters also burnt several trucks carrying food aid, the report added. According to media reports, "most of the people on board the vehicles (relief food trucks)" were killed in the attack.

title: They see beauty in everything: Nawazuddin on female directors
description: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui, while sharing his experience of working with female directors, said that women look at the world differently. He added that they are far more compassionate and see beauty in everything. Nawazuddin has worked with several female directors, including Nandita Das, Anusha Rizvi, Zoya Akhtar, Reema Kagti and Debamitra Biswal.

title: 7 torch vehicles over complaint against Bengal headmaster; arrested
description: The West Bengal Police on Saturday arrested seven persons for torching vehicles and creating unrest in Purba Medinipur over a corruption complaint against a school headmaster, Nandakumar SHO Manoj Kumar Jhano said. Police personnel, who were attacked by students and locals when they tried to control the situation, had to resort to lathicharge to disperse the mob, the SHO added.

title: NGT orders Bengal to pay ₹3,500 crore for gap in waste management
description: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has imposed a penalty of ₹3,500 crore on the West Bengal government for allegedly not managing solid and liquid waste, causing harm to the environment. Continuing damage is required to be prevented in the future and past damage is to be restored, the bench said. The penalty is to be paid within two months.

title: Cleric passing info on military to Pakistan arrested by J&K Police
description: J&K Police have, with inputs from Military Intelligence, arrested a local cleric from a mosque in Kishtwar for allegedly running a terror-cum-espionage module. Abdul Wahid was reportedly working for terror group Kashmir Janbaaz Force, which is being controlled by Pakistan. The 22-year-old cleric was allegedly passing information on military deployment and movement to his contact across the border.

title: Liquor sale banned in certain areas of Bengaluru during this weekend
description: In view of the Ganesh Chaturthi's idol immersion processions over this weekend, the Bengaluru Police have prohibited the sale of liquor in certain areas of the city. The areas are located across three police divisions namely the eastern, north-eastern and northern divisions of Bengaluru. However, the dates of the prohibition order's implementation vary across areas.

title: Thank you for inspiring all of us to pursue our dreams: Woods on Serena
description: Talking about Serena Williams whose defeat against Ajla Tomljanovic in the US Open marked the last match of her career, golfer Tiger Woods tweeted, "Thank you for inspiring all of us to pursue our dreams." "How lucky were we to...watch a young girl from Compton...become one of the greatest athletes of all time," tweeted former US First Lady Michelle Obama.

title: Hyd BJP Corporator arrested for allegedly kidnapping 22-yr-old man
description: Baddam Prem Maheshwar Reddy, BJP Corporator from Hyderabad's Gaddiannaram, was arrested on Saturday in connection with the alleged kidnapping of a 22-year-old man from PNT Colony. Earlier, police traced the man to Nalgonda and made three arrests. While interrogating the arrested men, police learnt that Reddy had pre-planned the kidnap and made arrangements for a car to abduct the man.

title: Govt shares pics of 'future look' of New Delhi Railway Station, Twitter users react
description: Ministry of Railways shared photos of the proposed design of the to-be redeveloped New Delhi Railway Station. While some Twitter users appreciated the modern architecture, one comment read, "This looks great but seems like 2050 plan looking at the amount of land acquisition/development this requires." "Glass building in heat of...Delhi...Just wasting money," another comment read.

title: Kartik Aaryan, Kiara Advani begin shooting for 'SatyaPrem Ki Katha'
description: Director Sameer Vidwans' 'SatyaPrem Ki Katha', starring Kartik Aaryan and Kiara Advani, went on floors on Saturday. The actors took to their respective Instagram handles to share the news, writing, "Sattu Aur Katha. Love Story Begins Today." The film is a musical love story that brings Kartik and Kiara together for the second time after 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'.

title: Tenure extension of St Stephen's principal illegal: DU
description: Delhi University (DU) has told St Stephen's College's Chairman, its Supreme Council and Governing Body that its Principal John Varghese is continuing illegally in the post since March 2021. DU said the college did not follow University Grants Commission regulations when extending his term. DU said it found the college's Supreme Council violating due processes and procedures.

title: 18-yr-old Gauff, 28-yr-old Garcia reach their maiden 4th round at US Open
description: US' Coco Gauff and France's Caroline Garcia entered the fourth round at the US Open for the first time in their career on Friday. The 18-year-old American, who is playing in her third US Open, beat compatriot Madison Keys 6-2, 6-3 in the third round, while the 28-year-old Frenchwoman defeated former champion Bianca Andreescu 6-3, 6-2.

title: Court issues contempt notice to Delhi Police Commissioner in rape case
description: A Delhi court has issued a contempt notice to Police Commissioner, Delhi, in an alleged gangrape case. The bench noted Sangam Vihar Police Station registered the FIR in the case after 36 days of the victim filing a complaint before the Station House Officer. The court said this "depicted a sordid and pathetic state of affairs" in Delhi Police's administration.

title: Pilot allegedly steals plane, threatens to crash it into US Walmart store; video surfaces
description: A pilot allegedly stole an aircraft and threatened to crash it into a Walmart store in US' Tupelo. The police evacuated the buildings and asked citizens to avoid the area. Several users on Twitter shared videos showing the plane flying in circles over homes and businesses. All emergency services in the area are on alert.

title: Class 2 boy mauled by 2 pitbulls in Bengaluru, his face disfigured
description: Two pitbulls reportedly attacked a Class 2 student for the second time in around seven months in Bengaluru. His father claimed that the dogs' owner, who lives in the same building as the seven-year-old boy, had provoked the dogs to attack the child during an argument. "My son's face has been disfigured...He needed 58 stitches...His condition is critical," he added.

title: Pune leading shift to alternative transport fuel: Fadnavis
description: The Maharashtra government is shifting public transport to alternate fuel and Pune is leading the change, Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said. "The Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) is leading the change with 650...electric buses, which implies that 30% of PMPML transportation is using alternative fuel," he said. Fadnavis spoke at an electric bus depot launch in Pune.

title: Delhi Police personnel assaulted in road rage incident
description: A Delhi Police head constable was allegedly assaulted by two motorcycle-borne men in Delhi's Vikaspuri area in a road rage incident on Thursday. According to police, the victim was travelling in his car when he was signalled to stop by a motorcycle rider. The biker and his pillion rider assaulted the victim after complaining about his driving, police said.

title: Bengaluru Police bust car stealing racket; 2 arrested
description: The Bengaluru Police have arrested two people for running a car stealing racket across Delhi and Bengaluru. The accused used to steal cars and then change their number plates and chassis numbers, police said. Nine cars worth around ₹1.2 crore have been recovered by the police. The DCP (Bengaluru Central Division) RS Gowda congratulated the team on their success.

title: Mumbai's Lokmanya Tilak Terminus to get pod hotel
description: After Mumbai Central and Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (CSMT), the railways is planning to bring a large-sized pod hotel at Kurla's Lokmanya Tilak Terminus (LTT). "Pod hotels offer a comfortable and affordable overnight staying option to passengers at stations. At the Kurla LTT...it will be opened near the Passenger Reservation System (PRS) ticket counter," a railway official said.

title: Almost 100% Indians breathing polluted air: Report
description: Over 99% of India's population is breathing polluted air, a report by Greenpeace India stated on Friday. Most people living in India are exposed to PM2.5 concentrations, which is five times more than the annual average guideline prescribed by WHO. As per the report, most polluted region in India is Delhi-NCR, followed by Bihar, Uttar Pradesh, Haryana and West Bengal.

title: Want to develop Rajasthan as centre of religious tourism: CM Gehlot
description: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Saturday said his government wants to develop the state as a centre of religious tourism. "The state government is committed to providing the devotees all kinds of facilities and security," he said. "All religious places in the state should be beautiful and equipped with all facilities," CM Gehlot added.

title: Indian men's hockey team is now focussing on 2022-23 FIH Pro League: Surender
description: Indian men's hockey team defender Surender Kumar said his side is now focussing on 2022-23 FIH Hockey Pro League matches against New Zealand and Spain, beginning October 28. "We've to work hard and correct our mistakes in the camp now so that the mistakes don't happen again," he added. India won a silver medal at CWG 2022 last month.

title: Everyone in industry is saying 'bhakton ne barbad kar di': Vivek on 'Laal...'
description: Vivek Agnihotri, speaking about failure of 'Laal Singh Chaddha', said, "Everyone in...industry is saying 'bhakton ne film ko barbad kar diya (bhakts ruined the film)'." "But...how many votes PM Narendra Modi gets? 40% okay? So let's take this 40-50% away...Where are...rest of...people?" he said, adding people didn't watch the film because they didn't know what it was all about.

title: Can't be a sentence less than life imprisonment for murder convict: SC
description: The Supreme Court on Friday said that there cannot be any sentence/punishment less than life imprisonment, if an accused is convicted of murder. Justices MR Shah and Krishna Murari made the statement while quashing the judgement of Madhya Pradesh High Court, which had reduced the sentence of a murder convict from life imprisonment to the sentence already undergone by him.

title: 2 cab drivers abduct, rape 25-yr-old woman in Bengaluru; arrested
description: Two cab drivers were arrested in Bengaluru for allegedly abducting and raping a 25-year-old woman on the pretext of dropping her to her destination, police said. The woman was reportedly walking on a road on Wednesday when she was approached by two bike-borne men, who took her to an isolated place and raped her. They also kept her in captivity.

title: Axar is correct like-to-like replacement for Jadeja at Asia Cup: Irfan
description: Commenting on Ravindra Jadeja being replaced by Axar Patel in India's squad for remainder of Asia Cup 2022, Irfan Pathan said the all-rounder is the "absolutely correct like-to-like replacement". He added, "Only problem is that Jadeja had become such a fantastic batter that you could've batted him up the order, you might not be able to do that with Axar."

title: Efforts being made to defame Rajasthan: Gehlot on NCRB report
description: After the report of National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) was released, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said efforts are being made to defame the state. It would be appropriate to compare the figures of 2019 and 2021 as there was a lockdown in 2020, Gehlot said. "Uttar Pradesh is ahead in...murder cases, crime against women and kidnapping," he added.

title: 3, including a woman, killed as bike collides with truck in UP
description: Three people, including a woman, were killed in Uttar Pradesh's Sonbhadra on Saturday after the motorcycle they were travelling on collided head-on with a truck, police said. The deceased were identified as 25-year-old Majmuddin Ansari, 27-year-old Ishtiyak Ansari and 30-year-old Gulabi. The trio died on the spot, while the truck driver escaped after the accident, SHO Lakshman Parvat said.

title: 20-yr-old man dies after speeding BMW sports car falls off Yamuna Expressway in Noida
description: A 20-year-old man was killed while another was injured after a speeding BMW sports car spun out of control and fell off the Greater Noida Yamuna Expressway on Saturday morning. The incident happened near Galgotias University in Dankaur area. The accident took place at around 8.30 am when the two men, who hail from Haryana, were going towards Agra.

title: SC to hear plea on violence against doctors on Monday
description: The Supreme Court on Monday will hear a plea seeking directions to ensure adequate security at hospitals and medical centres to deter attacks on doctors and healthcare workers, primarily by relatives of patients. The petition also seeks directions to Centre and states for the formation of a distress fund to grant compensation to victims of such violence or their families.

title: There's so much to learn from them: Mouni on co-stars Ranbir, Alia
description: Actress Mouni Roy in an interview said her 'Brahmastra' co-stars Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt are very disciplined and amazing human beings. "There's so much to learn from the two of them," Mouni said, adding, "One thing I tell everybody, whenever I get asked about Ranbir-Alia, is that they are fire. They light up on screen."

title: Drug smuggling accused arrested by Odisha Police from Ghaziabad
description: The main accused in a drug smuggling case was arrested by a Special Task Force (STF) team of Odisha Police from Ghaziabad on Thursday. The arrest was in connection with the seizure of 202 grams of cocaine worth around ₹50 lakh from Bhubaneswar in April this year. The Odisha Police team was assisted by UP Police in making the arrest.

title: Scindia urges states to lower VAT on aviation turbine fuel
description: Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia urged states to reduce value-added tax (VAT) on aviation turbine fuel (ATF). He said only 16 of the 24 states had responded positively to this proposal, adding that ATF accounted for 40% of the airlines' cost structure. Scindia said currently only eight states are charging VAT at 20-30%, while 16 states charge 1-4% VAT rates.

title: Ousted SL Prez gets official residence, security on return: Officials
description: Sri Lanka's ousted President Gotabaya Rajapaksa was provided with an official residence and security by the government after he returned home on Saturday after fleeing the country in July, officials said. Rajapaksa fled Sri Lanka on July 13 following mass protests amid the economic crisis. He had resigned after arriving in Singapore on July 14 and later travelled to Thailand.

title: Ayan has put a lot of energy into creating Astraverse: Rajamouli on Brahmastra
description: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli, who was roped in to present Ayan Mukerji's directorial 'Brahmastra' in South, has said this kind of film needs to be supported. "When Ayan started narrating about these Astras to me, all my childhood fantasies came to life," he added. Rajamouli further said Ayan has put a lot of energy into creating 'Astraverse'.

title: Ghana man swallows 87 cocaine capsules worth ₹13 cr, held in Mumbai
description: The Customs department arrested a passenger from Ghana at the Mumbai airport for trying to smuggle cocaine into India by hiding it in 87 capsules that he had swallowed. The Customs said 1,300 grams of cocaine valued at ₹13 crore was recovered. The accused was reportedly admitted to a state-run hospital, where he ejected those capsules over three days.

title: He was always keen to take the ball: Rajkumar on Kohli's bowling
description: Talking about Virat Kohli's bowling, his childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma said the India batter was always confident as a bowler. "Morne Morkel did dent his confidence a bit in...past (laughs) but he was always keen to take the ball...used to say- 'give me the ball, I will pick wickets'," he added. Kohli posted 1-0-6-0 against Hong Kong at Asia Cup.

title: PM Modi writes letter to UAE President to strengthen strategic ties
description: PM Narendra Modi has written a letter to UAE President Sheikh Mohamed Bin Zayed Al Nahyan to talk about further strengthening strategic relations between the countries. PM Modi's letter was delivered by EAM S Jaishankar when he met the UAE President in Dubai. According to UAE's news agency, the letter also talks of developing strategic relations to serve common interests.

title: No rules violated: BJP's Nishikant Dubey on Deoghar airport incident
description: After being booked for forcing flight take-off at the Deoghar airport, BJP MP Nishikant Dubey rejected all the claims and said that there was no violation of rules. "File as many cases you want to file. A total of 37 cases have been filed against me and my family...This fight will continue for justice," said Dubey.

title: T'gana BJP leader criticises Owaisi over 'China occupying 10 villages' remark
description: Telangana BJP leader NV Subhash criticised AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi over his comments attacking the Centre. Subhash said Owaisi is spreading negativity, adding, "He is giving provocative and false statements." "I also hope INS Vikrant will give PM Narendra Modi the courage to speak up about China which has occupied 10 villages of our territory," Owaisi had said.

title: Pune's Corbevax vaccine wastage rate higher than state average
description: Pune district's Corbevax vaccine wastage rate is higher than the state average as fresh COVID-19 cases continue to fall. While the vaccine wastage rate in Maharashtra is 13.31%, the wastage rate in Pune district is 13.86%. In Pune district, only 1,054 Corbevax doses have been used as precaution, said State Immunisation Officer Dr Sachin Desai.

title: US customer data compromised in July cybersecurity breach: Samsung
description: Samsung Electronics said on Friday that the personal information of some customers in the US was compromised as it suffered a cybersecurity breach in late July. The company said that customers' social security numbers and credit card numbers were not affected, however, information including name, contact and demographic details, date of birth and product registration data had been compromised.

title: Couple's bodies recovered from rail tracks in UP, suicide suspected
description: The bodies of a 22-year-old man and a 19-year-old woman were recovered from railway tracks in Uttar Pradesh's Banda district. According to police, the two were in a relationship, however, their family members were against it as they belonged to different castes. They allegedly died by suicide by jumping in front of a moving train on Saturday, police added.

title: Cong to hold protest in Delhi on Sunday against price rise, GST
description: The Congress is set to hold a protest at Delhi's Ramlila Maidan on Sunday against price rise, unemployment and the GST hike on essential items. Rahul Gandhi and other party leaders would address the rally in which workers from Delhi, Haryana, UP and other parts of the country would participate. Sonia and Priyanka Gandhi would not be attending the event.

title: Russia sees over 50,000 new COVID-19 cases for 2nd straight day
description: For the second consecutive day on Saturday, Russia reported more than 50,000 new COVID-19 cases, with 51,699 testing positive. The country also recorded 92 coronavirus-related deaths over the last 24 hours, the government's coronavirus task force said. Russia reported 50,952 new COVID-19 cases on Friday, breaching the 50,000 mark for the first time in almost six months.

title: Very soon we will break JD(U)-RJD alliance in Bihar: BJP's Sushil Modi
description: BJP MP Sushil Kumar Modi has said, "Very soon, we will break the JD(U)-RJD alliance in Bihar and make the state JD(U) free." Commenting on five JD(U) MLAs joining BJP in Manipur, he said, "The state has become JD(U)-free. Those MLAs wanted to remain in NDA." He further said that nobody can become the PM by installing hoardings and posters.

title: Mysterious explosion in Hyd leaves house with no walls, couple injured
description: A mysterious explosion in a house on the first floor of a building in Ramgopalpet in Secunderabad left the house with no walls. Other parts of the building were also damaged in the incident. A couple living in the house was seriously injured and was shifted to a local hospital. CCTV visuals reportedly showed the moment of the blast.

title: 7-yr-old Thane boy drowns in lake meant for Ganesh idol immersions
description: A seven-year-old boy, Jaihad Azhar Shaikh, from Rabodi in Thane drowned in a lake meant for Ganesh idol immersions on Friday night, an official said. The incident took place at Ambe-Ghosale Lake when the deceased went for a swim at 8 pm, chief of Thane civic body's Regional Disaster Management Cell said. He added that the body was recovered.

title: Hyd company to recycle Noida twin towers' waste into green building material
description: The 30,000 tonnes of debris left after the demolition of Noida's twin towers will be recycled into green building material by Hyderabad-based company Re Sustainability Ltd. It'll process 300 tonnes of waste, including concrete, steel and iron per day at its Noida plant. "We're looking forward to witnessing magnificent infrastructure developed using...recycled material," the company CEO said.

title: I'm ready to be a mom, explore a different version of myself: Serena
description: Following her loss in the last match of her career in US Open 2022 third round, 40-year-old Serena Williams said, "I'm ready to...be a mom, explore a different version of Serena." She added, "Technically in the world I'm still super young, so I want to have a little bit of a life while I'm still walking."

title: We are determined to implement price cap on Russian oil: US
description: The US has said it is "determined" to enforce a price cap on Russian oil announced by G7 countries, even as Moscow said that it would stop selling oil to nations that impose price caps. "A price cap on Russian oil is a powerful tool...in our agenda to put downward pressure on global energy prices," White House Press Secretary said.

title: 12-yr-old electrocuted in Greater Noida Ganesh Chaturthi fair, organiser held
description: A 12-year-old boy was allegedly killed by electrocution at a fair organised on the occasion of Ganesh Chaturthi in Greater Noida on Thursday. An organiser of the fair has been arrested in the case. "The post-mortem report of the deceased indicates that he died due to electric shock to his body," said Abhishek Verma, Deputy Commissioner of Police, Greater Noida.

title: Suspended Telangana MRO found dead at her residence in Hyderabad
description: A suspended Telangana Mandal Revenue Officer (MRO), Sujatha, who was arrested in a land scam two years ago, was allegedly found dead under suspicious circumstances at her residence in Hyderabad on Saturday. The cause of her death is yet to be ascertained. Sujatha's family member claimed that she was undergoing treatment for dengue and suffered a cardiac arrest.

title: Nora Fatehi might be interrogated again: Delhi Police on extortion case
description: Economic Offences Wing of Delhi Police is likely to call actor Nora Fatehi once again for questioning in connection with ₹200 crore extortion case allegedly involving conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar. "She was cooperating during the investigation but there are some questions whose answers have not been found yet and there might be a need to inquire her again," said an official.

title: 3 labourers die after stone slabs fall at construction site in Jaipur
description: At least three labourers were killed and one got injured on Friday evening after stone slabs fell on them at a construction site in the Jagatpura area in Rajasthan's Jaipur, police said. The incident took place when the victims were shifting granite stones to a loader. Notably, the labourers were engaged in the construction of a private hospital.

title: 3 burglars held, valuables worth ₹33 lakh recovered in Hyderabad
description: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Saturday solved a case of burglary and arrested three persons in connection with the case. The Rachakonda Police tweeted that 36 tolas of gold ornaments, nine wrist watches, one digital camera, one two-wheeler, 405 US dollars and one mobile phone worth ₹33.02 lakh were recovered. The accused had reportedly broken into a house on August 31.

title: 42-year-old man found hanging in police custody in J&K's Rajouri
description: A 42-year-old man, booked in two separate cases, was found hanging in a police lock-up in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri district on Friday, said SSP Choudhary Mohammad Aslam. "He had made a sort of rope with the help of threads from a curtain and this morning, was found hanging from the window of the washroom," said Aslam.

title: Kejriwal 'biggest U-turn leader' in India: BJP leader Tejasvi Surya
description: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya on Saturday termed AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal the "biggest U-turn leader" in the country. "Arvind Kejriwal's politics is without credibility and integrity," he added. "Certainly, the youths of Gujarat will not provide even an inch of space for revdi (freebie) and bevdi (drunk) politics," Surya said while referring to the Excise Policy of the Delhi government.

title: Jacqueline made conman Sukesh pay ₹15 lakh to writer for web series script: ED
description: The Enforcement Directorate, in its supplementary chargesheet filed against Jacqueline Fernandez, claimed she admitted that conman Sukesh Chandrashekar gave ₹15 lakh in cash to writer Advaita Kala for a web series script. This contradicts her earlier statement to the investigating agency that she gave only chocolates and flowers to Kala. The transaction is now part of ED investigation.

title: Punjab man opens fire after arguing with neighbour over dog's poop
description: A man, his father and other accomplices allegedly opened fire at his neighbour's house in Punjab's Ludhiana on Friday after arguing with the neighbour who objected to the man's dog defecating near his house. The accused, who are yet to be arrested, reportedly fired two shots. The police have recovered two bullet shells from the spot.

title: After Paras Kalnawat, co-star Alma Hussein exits 'Anupamaa'
description: Actress Alma Hussein, who played the character of Sara Kapadia in 'Anupamaa', has quit the show. Talking about her exit, she said her "track was going nowhere" and she wasn't growing as an actor.  Earlier, actor Paras Kalnawat exited the show to participate in reality show 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10'. Paras played the role of Samar Shah in 'Anupamaa'.

title: Merger of Manipur JD(U) MLAs into BJP was done using money power: Lalan Singh
description: JD(U) chief Lalan Singh accused BJP of horse trading in Manipur. "Whatever happened in Manipur (merger of JD(U) MLAs into BJP) was done by BJP using money power. For the PM, coming together of Opposition parties is corruption," he said. JD(U) will become a national party no matter how hard the Bharatiya Janata Party tries to stop it, Singh claimed.

title: Day temperature in Pune city to rise over next few days: IMD
description: The day temperature in Pune city is likely to rise over the next few days, India Meteorological Department (IMD) said. "Day temperature in the city is likely to touch 34°C till September 4. Partly cloudy skies becoming generally cloudy towards the afternoon and light rainfall for the city are forecast till the end of this week," an official said.

title: 2,000 farmers died by suicide in Telangana from 2017 to 2019: FM
description: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Saturday criticised the Telangana government saying that at least 2,000 farmers died by suicide in the state between 2017 and 2019. "There is gross injustice being done to the farmers," she said, adding that the condition of farmers wasn't as good as the TRS government claims it to be.

title: 2-year-old girl dies after water tanker hits motorcycle in Thane
description: A two-year-old girl was killed when a water tanker hit a motorcycle in Bhiwandi, Thane. The deceased, Khatija Khan, was travelling on the motorcycle with her parents and minor sister, who also got injured in the accident, police said. The tanker owner, Pramnath Bagal, and the driver, Jairam Jaiswal, have been booked under culpable homicide charges.

title: Milan airport dog sniffs out 13 kg of cocaine hidden in wheelchair
description: A sniffer dog helped police at Malpensa Airport in Italy's Milan find some 13 kilograms of cocaine stuffed into the leather upholstery of a motorised wheelchair. Following the discovery, the wheelchair user, who was pretending to be a disabled person, immediately got up and walked unaided, the Financial Guard police said. The seized cocaine was worth around £1.2 million.

title: Pune's Chandani Chowk flyover may open by June 2023: Nitin Gadkari
description: Union Minister for Road Transport and Highways Nitin Gadkari has directed the authorities to complete the work on Pune's Chandani Chowk flyover by June 2023. He assured if issues about land acquisition for the project are resolved and land is acquired at two places (where it's currently facing resistance), the flyover will be launched by next year.

title: Hybrid LeT terrorist arrested in J&K, arms & ammunition recovered
description: The Jammu and Kashmir Police along with security forces arrested a hybrid terrorist of Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) in the Sopore region of Kashmir, police said on Saturday. The terrorist, identified as Saqib Shakeel Dar, was planning to carry out attacks on security forces and civilians, police added. One pistol, one magazine and eight pistol rounds were recovered from him.

title: Defending champion Medvedev to face 23rd seed Kyrgios in US Open 4th round
description: Defending champion Daniil Medvedev defeated China's Wu Yibing 6-4, 6-2, 6-2 to reach the men's singles fourth round at US Open 2022. The top seed will now face 23rd seed Nick Kyrgios, who reached the fourth round at US Open for the first time in his career. The Australian beat American wildcard JJ Wolf 6-4, 6-2, 6-3 in third round.

title: Actress Manju Warrier joins Ajith for a bike trip in Ladakh, shares pics
description: Actress Manju Warrier took to Instagram to share a few pictures with actor Ajith Kumar as they went on an adventurous bike tour in Ladakh. She wrote, "Huge thanks to...Super Star Rider Ajith Kumar Sir! This is the first time I'm doing a tour on a two-wheeler." The duo will be seen together in an upcoming film tentatively titled 'AK61'.

title: India's forex reserves fall by $3 billion to $561.04 billion
description: India's foreign exchange reserves fell by $3 billion to $561.04 billion in the week ended August 26, according to the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) data. The fall was because of a decline in the foreign currency assets (FCA) and the gold reserves. The FCA fell by $2.57 billion in the said week and gold reserves fell by $271 million.

title: 15 houses, 3 shops destroyed as cloudburst hits Dharamshala, rescue ops underway
description: Three shops and 15 houses were damaged after a cloudburst triggered flash floods in Himachal Pradesh's Dharamshala on Friday. Reports said that 45 sheep and goats also went missing. Senior officials directed relief workers to ramp up rehabilitation efforts. "Damage caused by rains is being reviewed and effective steps are being taken by district administration," Kangra Deputy Commissioner said.

title: Don't quit BJP, work for AAP internally: Kejriwal tells Guj BJP workers
description: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday appealed to BJP workers in Gujarat to work for Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) while staying in BJP. "Take...payment from there (BJP) but work for us...because we don't have money," he added. Kejriwal said BJP workers will benefit from all the "guarantees" promised by him to the people when AAP comes to power in Gujarat.

title: SC gives Finance Ministry 30 days more to open GST common portal
description: The Supreme Court has given the Finance Ministry a 30-day extension for opening of the Goods and Services Tax (GST) common portal. It also directed the GSTN to open a common portal for all taxpayers from October 1 till December 31. This would allow taxpayers to claim pending transitional credit due at the GST launch in 2017.

title: Video shows BJP MLA shouting at, threatening woman activist in B'luru
description: A video has emerged showing BJP MLA Aravind Limbavali shouting at and threatening a woman activist who was protesting against the demolition of a property in Bengaluru. The woman, Ruth Sagai Mary, was heard saying, "I'm talking with respect. You're speaking to a lady." Limbavali replied, "You've encroached the land...You want respect?" He asked the police to "take her away".

title: Paytm, Razorpay's Bengaluru offices raided by ED in Chinese loan apps case
description: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) said it's conducting raids at the Bengaluru offices of Paytm, Razorpay and Cashfree Payments in connection with "illegal" instant loan apps "controlled" by Chinese persons. The culprits were generating proceeds of crime through various accounts with payment gateways. This comes after several complaints of extortion by people who took loans through such apps.

title: Canadian TikTok star Tanya Pardazi dies aged 21 in skydiving accident
description: Canadian TikTok star Tanya Pardazi died in a skydiving accident on August 27. According to the 21-year-old former Miss Canada semi-finalist's friends, Pardazi died while performing the activity in Ontario, Canada. Pardazi opened her parachute too late while in the air during her first solo course, according to a statement by the skydiving company.

title: Will Smith showed he's as ugly as rest of us: Dave Chappelle on Oscars slap
description: Comedian Dave Chappelle on his England tour with Chris Rock spoke about the latter being slapped by Will Smith at the 2022 Oscars. Dave said onstage, "A lot of people forget who Will Smith is...Will did the impression of a perfect person for 30 years and he...showed us he was as ugly as the rest of us."

title: Youth hacks leopard to death after it pounces on him in Kerala
description: A tribal youth hacked a leopard to death in Kerala's Idukki on Saturday in alleged self-defence, forest officials said. The youth, who suffered injuries and was admitted to a hospital, used a machete-like weapon to attack the leopard after it pounced on him and mauled him. "A detailed probe would be held," Mankulam Divisional Forest Officer G Jayachandran said.

title: People who abuse PM are crying about freedom of expression: Kiren Rijiju
description: Reacting to retired SC judge Justice BN Srikrishna's "freedom of expression" remark, Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju said that people who abuse the popularly elected PM are crying about freedom of expression. In an interview, Srikrishna had said, "If I say that I don't like the face of PM, somebody might raid me, arrest me, throw me in the jail."

title: Pic made using AI wins art prize in US; criticised by artists
description: Several artists are criticising the decision to award the first prize to an AI-generated artwork in the digital art category in the Colorado State Fair's annual art competition. Jason Allen used an AI program called Midjourney to create the art and touched it up a bit. "I'm not going to apologise...I won, and I didn't break any rules," said Allen.

title: Motorcyclist killed after drunk woman mows him down in Delhi; arrested
description: A 35-year-old woman was arrested on Friday in East Delhi for allegedly mowing down a motorcyclist under the influence of alcohol, police said. The accident took place on NH-9 in East Vinod Nagar. The man, identified as 28-year-old Shakarpur resident Abhishek Kapoor, was rushed to MAX Hospital in Patparganj but was declared brought dead. A case has been registered.

title: FBI found over 11,000 govt records at Trump's home, unsealed records show
description: The FBI recovered more than 11,000 government documents and photographs, including 18 labelled as 'top secret', during its August 8 search at ex-US President Donald Trump's Florida home, according to court records that were unsealed on Friday. The FBI also seized 90 empty folders, 48 of which were marked 'classified' and 42 were labelled 'Return to Staff Secretary/Military Aide'.

title: Delhi Police arrests 2 men with 1.3 kg heroin worth ₹2 crore
description: Delhi Police arrested two men in Rohini with 1.3 kilograms of heroin worth ₹2 crore. One of the accused earlier spent five years in jail in connection with a robbery at Lahori Gate in 2014, police said. The second accused is a childhood friend of the first and was earlier arrested in a case under the Excise Act, police added.

title: Man arrested for raping 15-yr-old girl in Thane
description: A 19-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping and threatening a 15-year-old girl in Thane. The accused, Sameer Khan, used to stalk the girl, who was also his neighbour, and tried to speak to her multiple times, police said. The accused forcefully entered the victim's house last week when the latter's parents were away and allegedly committed the crime.

title: Hrithik Roshan to sport 3 different looks for 'Vikram Vedha', pics surface
description: Pictures have surfaced on social media which show actor Hrithik Roshan in his upcoming film 'Vikram Vedha'. As per reports, the actor will be seen sporting three different looks for the film to show the backstory of his character Vedha. The film is touted to be an action-thriller directed by filmmaking duo Pushkar-Gayatri and also features Saif Ali Khan.

title: Massive eviction drive to clear 330 acres of land underway in Assam
description: A massive eviction and anti-encroachment drive began in Assam's Sonitpur on Saturday morning to clear 330 acres of land. Over 1,000 security personnel have been deployed, state IGP (L&O) PK Bhuyan said. As most residents have vacated their houses, heavy machinery is being used to demolish the structures. According to government records, 299 families were living there, reported PTI.

title: Gujarat AAP chief Gopal Italia booked for defaming BJP leaders
description: Aam Aadmi Party's Gujarat President Gopal Italia has been booked for allegedly defaming BJP leaders, including the state's MoS Home Harsh Sanghavi and party's state chief CR Paatil. The complainant alleged that Italia called Sanghavi "Drugs Sanghavi" and Paatil a "former bootlegger". He further claimed that the AAP leader incited the public against the state.

title: When I look at Rahul's body language, I feel he can't do anything: RP Singh
description: Ex-India pacer RP Singh said Rishabh Pant should be picked in the lineup for Team India's upcoming match against Pakistan, going on to name KL Rahul as the player who should be rested. "Rahul isn't showing much promise. When I look at his body language, it feels he can't do anything," added Singh. "His...reading of match situations [is]...concerning," he stated.

title: I have shut it out of life: Karan Johar on boycott Bollywood trend
description: Speaking about the boycott Bollywood trend on social media, filmmaker Karan Johar said that he has shut it out of life and chooses to focus only on positivity. He added that by listening and reacting to negative things, you attract the same energy. "I think that you have to turn a blind eye towards negativity in general," the filmmaker said.

title: 3 auto drivers rob man of phone, cash in Pimpri-Chinchwad; arrested
description: Pimpri-Chinchwad Police on Friday arrested three autorickshaw drivers who allegedly robbed a man of his phone and cash worth a total of ₹16,000. The incident took place on Tuesday when the man, who is a construction worker, hired an autorickshaw to travel from Alandi to Dudulgaon. A police sub-inspector said that the trio had threatened the man.

title: Citi cuts mortgage team's size amid housing market slowdown in US
description: Citigroup on Friday said it has fired some workers of its mortgage team "due to internal streamlining of functions" and is helping affected workers find new roles "within Citi or outside the firm". Reportedly, less than 100 positions were affected by the job cuts. This comes as increasing prices and mortgage rates have slowed down the housing market in US.

title: 'Danielle' becomes first Atlantic hurricane this year, moving at 120 km/hr
description: Tropical storm 'Danielle' has strengthened into the first hurricane of 2022 Atlantic Ocean season, the US National Hurricane Center said. The storm, which became a hurricane just before 10:50 am Eastern time on Friday, doesn't present immediate threat to land. It was about 1,440 km west of the Azores in the North Atlantic with maximum sustained winds of 120 km/hr.

title: We are mulling India listing: Nasdaq-listed MakeMyTrip’s Founder
description: MakeMyTrip Founder and Chairman Deep Kalra said the travel aggregator is thinking of getting listed in India. "When we listed in 2010, India was not ready for internet stocks," he said. Kalra also said that some of the internet companies which went public last year in India may have been misguided. The Nasdaq-listed MakeMyTrip settled at $33 apiece on Thursday.

title: Thanks Serena Williams for everything you've done for our sport: Nadal
description: After 23-time Grand Slam champion Serena Williams played the last match of her career at US Open 2022, Rafael Nadal took to Instagram Stories and wrote, "Thanks Serena Williams for everything you've done for our sport!!! Amazing champion." Unseeded Australian Ajla Tomljanovic beat Serena 7-5, 6-7(4-7), 6-1 in the third round in New York today.

title: Skyroot Aerospace raises $51 million in funding round led by GIC
description: Hyderabad-based space-tech startup Skyroot Aerospace has raised around $51 million in a Series B financing round led by GIC. GIC's India Managing Director Mayank Rawat will now join Skyroot's board. This is the largest funding round ever in the Indian space-tech sector, the company said. Skyroot Aerospace was founded by Pawan Kumar Chandana and Naga Bharath Daka in 2018.

title: Crypto firm's CEO, who faces 40,000-yr jail for stealing $2 bn, arrested in Albania
description: Turkish cryptocurrency exchange platform Thodex's CEO Faruk Fatih Özer, accused of stealing $2 billion from thousands of clients, has been arrested in Albania, said Turkey. Further, the process to extradite Özer, who fled Turkey after Thodex was shut down last year, has started. He, along with other executives of Thodex, faces over 40,000 years in prison for alleged fraud.

title: Age is not what body tells you, but what your mind tells body: Sachin as Serena retires
description: Sachin Tendulkar took to Twitter to congratulate Serena Williams following her retirement aged 40. He wrote, "Age is not what the body tells you...but what your mind tells the body. Teenagers can solve world's biggest problems, adults can pick up something new & excel." He added, "Sport inspires society to push limits & achieve the impossible....Congratulations on an inspiring career."

title: Security beefed up in Goshamahal in view of bandh over Raja Singh's arrest
description: In view of the shutdown called by supporters of suspended BJP MLA Raja Singh, Hyderabad Police has beefed up security in parts of Goshamahal constituency. "Why a hate speaker like Owaisi was not held under the Preventive Detentions (PD) Act and why only Raja Singh has been held under it? Government [is working] with AIMIM," said Sri Ram Yuva Sena.

title: I love being objectified, I'm just a piece of meat: Ranveer Singh
description: Actor Ranveer Singh made an appearance on reality show 'Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives' in which he said, "I love being objectified. I am just a piece of meat. Just a battery-operated device." He also complimented Sanjay Kapoor's wife Maheep Kapoor over her appearance in 1994 music video 'Nigori Kaisi Jawani Hai', saying she looked like a malai kofta.

title: Goa Police recovers 3 diaries from Sonali Phogat’s Haryana residence
description: Goa Police have recovered three diaries from the Haryana residence of late TikTok star and BJP leader Sonali Phogat. Police also inspected Sonali's bedroom, wardrobe, and password-protected locker. The locker has been sealed by the police, reports said. "We are still investigating and scrutinizing the case...a conclusion can only be drawn once we are through with investigation," police said.

title: Revoke or face 'counter-measures': China to US on $1.1 bn arms package to Taiwan
description: China on Friday warned the US to revoke the $1.1 billion arms package to Taiwan and warned the country of "counter-measures" on failing to do so. It added that the aid to Taiwan "severely jeopardises" the relations between the US and China. "China will resolutely take legitimate and necessary counter-measures," Chinese embassy spokesman Liu Pengyu said.

title: Develop State Capital Region on lines of Delhi-NCR: UP CM to officials
description: UP CM Yogi Adityanath has directed officials to form 'Uttar Pradesh State Capital Region (SCR)' along the lines of the Delhi-National Capital Region (NCR). During a review meeting, Yogi said the population pressure is increasing in the neighbouring districts of Lucknow. Therefore, keeping future requirements in mind, Lucknow and its surrounding districts can be developed into an SCR, Yogi added.

title: Motherf*cker hit me over nicest joke I ever told: Chris Rock on Oscars slap
description: Comedian Chris Rock during his comedy show with Dave Chappelle in England joked with the audience about the 2022 Oscars slap incident. He said, "Did that sh*t hurt? Goddamn right. The motherf*cker hit me over a bullsh*t joke, the nicest joke I ever told." Chris had joked about Will Smith's wife Jada Pinkett Smith's lack of hair due to alopecia.

title: Ranveer Singh makes his first startup investment, invests in SUGAR Cosmetics
description: Actor Ranveer Singh has made his first startup investment by investing in beauty products startup SUGAR Cosmetics. The startup announced the actor's investment on Saturday, however, it didn't disclose the amount of investment. Founded by IIM Ahmedabad alumni Vineeta Singh and Kaushik Mukherjee, the startup sells cosmetics through both online and offline routes. In May, it raised $50 million.

title: Expanding anus by hands & pouring substance in it, prima facie not carnal intercourse: HC
description: Bombay High Court observed that act of "expanding the anus by hands and pouring some substance into it, prima facie cannot be said to be...carnal intercourse". The court said this while granting bail to a man accused of unnatural offences against a seven-year-old girl. The court noted that no injuries to the anus were recorded in her medical report.

title: Amazon's $1.7 billion takeover of iRobot under review in US: Report
description: US' Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has reportedly started reviewing Amazon's $1.7 billion deal to acquire Roomba vacuum maker iRobot. The wide-ranging review will analyse whether the deal will illegally boost Amazon's market share in both the connected device market and the retail market in general, Politico reported citing sources. The all-cash deal was announced last month.

title: Man dies as 25 gunny bags full of rice fall on him in godown in Tamil Nadu
description: A 35-year-old man died after 25 gunny bags full of rice fell on him in a godown in Tamil Nadu's Periyapalayam. Reports said he had been asked to stack the bags on the shelves. He reportedly sat down to rest when the bags came falling down on him. A few employees rushed to incident site after they heard his voice.

title: Big B shares poster, release date of 'Goodbye' with Rashmika
description: Veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan on Saturday took to social media to share the poster of his upcoming film 'Goodbye' which also features Rashmika Mandanna and Neena Gupta. He wrote alongside the poster that the film will release in theatres on October 7. He can be seen flying a kite in the poster as Rashmika holds the kite spool.

title: Audience wants more than what we're delivering: Jr NTR on film industry
description: Speaking about the failures faced by the Indian film industry, actor Jr NTR said that the audience wants more than what they are delivering. He further said that the film industry is under pressure and needs to accept this challenge to make better films for the audience. "Not putting anybody down here. Let's accept the challenge," the actor added.

title: Gunmen kidnap worshippers attending prayers at mosque in Nigeria
description: Gunmen have kidnapped dozens of worshippers attending Friday afternoon prayers at a mosque in Zamfara state in Nigeria, police said. "The Zamfara state police command in collaboration with military and vigilantes have dispatched personnel for the search and rescue operation," a police spokesman said. The men were reportedly disguised as worshippers and hid the guns under their garments.

title: Madrassa caretaker in Hyd arrested for sexually assaulting student
description: A madrassa caretaker has been arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting a 14-year-old student in Hyderabad. The accused, identified as Qasim, was booked under POCSO Act after the victim's mother filed a complaint with the police. The minor boy was reportedly assaulted several times and was threatened with dire consequences if he revealed the ordeal to anyone.

title: MP govt exempts students of 1.30 lakh schools from carrying bags once a week
description: Madhya Pradesh government has decided to exempt students of 1.30 lakh schools from carrying bags once a week. MP has 1.30 lakh schools with a collective strength of 1.54 crore students, an official said. The students of Classes 1-2 will have to carry school bags weighing 1.6 to 2.2 kg while students of Classes 3-5, weighing 1.7 to 2.5 kg.

title: Venus Williams is the only reason I ever existed: Serena Williams
description: Following her 5-7, 7-6(7-4), 1-6 defeat against Australia's Ajla Tomljanović in the US Open's third round, marking her career's last match, Serena Williams said her sister Venus Williams is the "only reason" she ever existed. "It's been the most incredible...journey I've ever been on...in my life," added Serena. "It all started with my parents and they deserved everything," she stated.

title: India pips UK, our colonial ruler: Kotak on India becoming 5th largest economy
description: Kotak Mahindra Bank's CEO Uday Kotak said it is a "proud moment for India to pip UK, our colonial ruler" to become the world's fifth largest economy. "But a reality check of population denominator: India: 1.4 bn vs UK: 0.068 bn. Hence, per capita GDP we [are] at $2,500 vs $47,000. We've miles to go," Kotak wrote in a tweet.

title: Nitish 'lame duck CM': BJP leader as 5 JD(U) MLAs join BJP in Manipur
description: After five of the six JD(U) MLAs in Manipur joined the BJP on Friday, BJP leader Amit Malviya called Bihar CM Nitish Kumar a "lame duck CM". He also claimed that Kumar "is seeing his party's footprint shrink, not just in Bihar, where it is the third largest, but also outside", yet is still dreaming about becoming the Prime Minister.

title: Tamilnad Mercantile Bank raises ₹363 crore from anchor investors
description: Tamilnad Mercantile Bank said it has raised ₹363.53 crore from anchor investors before its initial public offering (IPO) that will open for subscription on September 5. A total of 71,28,000 equity shares have been allotted to anchor investors at ₹510 apiece, it said. Nomura, Societe Generale, Max Life Insurance and Kotak Mahindra Life Insurance are some of the anchor investors.

title: 1.45 lakh litre of raw material for illicit liquor destroyed in Punjab
description: Punjab's excise department recovered and destroyed 1.45 lakh litre of lahan, raw material used to make illicit liquor, on the spot outside river banks in Ludhiana on Friday. State minister Harpal Singh Cheema said, "[Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann-led government] will continue to break...back of liquor mafia and nobody involved will be spared." Drones were used in the search operation.

title: CM in denial: NCW chief after Gehlot says 50% rape charges in Raj false
description: After Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said that around 50% rape charges in the state are false, National Commission for Women (NCW) chief Rekha Sharma said Gehlot is denying the actual data regarding his state. "Exactly with the same mindset, his police works and that is why women in the state don't get justice," Rekha Sharma tweeted on Saturday.

title: Kyrgyzstan's 1st female President named UN envoy to Afghanistan
description: Roza Otunbayeva, Kyrgyzstan's first female President, has been appointed as the new UN special envoy for Afghanistan. Otunbayeva, who served as Kyrgyzstan's President from 2010 to 2011, will replace Canada's Deborah Lyons. "Otunbayeva brings to the position over 35 years of...experience in leadership, diplomacy, civic engagement and international cooperation," UN chief António Guterres said.

title: I want people to know me as Shehnaaz now, not 'Punjab ki Katrina': Shehnaaz
description: Actress Shehnaaz Gill stated she wants the tag of 'Punjab ki Katrina' to go away because she wants to make her identity as Shehnaaz Gill now. "Katrina Kaif is Katrina Kaif and I like her so much but I want...people to know me as Shehnaaz," she added. She is set to make her Bollywood debut with Salman Khan.

title: One of the biggest upsets: Sehwag on Zimbabwe's historic win vs Aus
description: Discussing Zimbabwe's historic win against Australia on Australian soil in ODIs, Virender Sehwag tweeted, "One of the biggest upsets in...ODI cricket." "Well done Zimbabwe [on]...beating a full strength Australian side...Feels good when an underdog does well," added Sehwag. Australia had beaten Zimbabwe in 12 out of 13 ODI matches played between the teams in Australia before this game.

title: Chidambaram calls Teesta Setalvad 'a courageous fighter for justice'
description: Congress MP P Chidambaram praised Supreme Court for its decision to grant interim bail to activist Teesta Setalvad and called her "a courageous fighter for justice".
