Earlier on Friday, the SC had granted interim bail to the activist in a case in which she was arrested for allegedly fabricating documents to frame innocent people in the 2002 Gujarat riots cases.

title: 'KGF 2' f*cked up everything, nobody in B'wood liked it: Ram Gopal Varma
description: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma in an interview stated that nobody in Bollywood liked Yash-starrer 'K.G.F: Chapter 2'. The filmmaker further stated that a very big director of Bollywood said he tried to watch it five times but couldn't go beyond half an hour. "Two films that have f**ked up everything are 'K.G.F: Chapter 2' and 'The Kashmir Files'," he added.

title: Aim to transform Jammu as eco-city for sustainable economic activities: LG Sinha
description: J&K LG Manoj Sinha said that his aim is to transform Jammu into an eco-city for sustainable economic activities. "Inaugurated and laid the foundation stone of 14 projects of Jammu Smart city. These projects will create a smart living by improving quality of life, better public services, opportunities for local economic development and easier accessibility to everyone," said Sinha.

title: Udaipur cook asks students to throw meals served by Dalit girls, arrested
description: A cook was arrested for allegedly asking students in a government school to throw mid-day meals reportedly served by two Dalit girls in Rajasthan's Udaipur, police said. "A case against the cook was registered under the Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes (Prevention of Atrocities) Act, 1989," police added. "A prompt action was taken...the matter was found true," police stated.

title: 'Brahmāstra' pre-release event cancelled in Hyd; Rajamouli, Jr NTR apologise
description: The pre-release event of Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Brahmāstra' scheduled for Friday at Hyderabad's Ramoji Rao studios was cancelled at the last minute. Actor Jr NTR was to appear as the chief guest. Filmmaker SS Rajamouli apologised for the cancellation, saying that police personnel were busy on duty due to Ganesh Chaturthi. Jr NTR also apologised for the cancellation.

title: Voting closes in UK PM race between Sunak & Truss; result on Sept 5
description: The voting in the Conservative Party leadership race between Rishi Sunak and Liz Truss to replace Boris Johnson as Britain's next PM closed on Friday. The result will be announced on September 5 at 12:30 pm BST (17:00 pm IST). The winner will be formally appointed PM on September 6 by Queen Elizabeth II at Balmoral, her castle in Scotland.

title: Ex-Army jawan arrested over abusive posts against Gujarat BJP MLA
description: An ex-Army jawan, identified as Lakhanashi Odedara, was arrested on Friday for allegedly threatening Gujarat BJP MLA Babubhai Bokhiria and sharing abusive posts on social media against him. "Odedara was arrested after some persons pointed out to Porbandar MLA Bokhiria that he had used abusive language against him on Facebook," said a police official.

title: Shabana, Akhtar, Naseeruddin sleeper cells of 'tukde-tukde gang': MP minister
description: MP Home Minister Narottam Mishra on Friday called Bollywood artists Shabana Azmi, Javed Akhtar and Naseeruddin Shah the sleeper cells of the 'tukde-tukde gang'. The statement comes after Azmi broke down while talking about the release of Bilkis Bano's rape convicts during a TV interview. Mishra accused the artists of remaining silent on incidents that happen in Congress-ruled states.

title: LS Speaker Om Birla unveils Swami Vivekananda's 1st statue in Mexico
description: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla on Saturday unveiled the first statue of Swami Vivekananda in Mexico. "The statue will be a source of inspiration for people, especially for the youth of the region to strive and bring the change which will take their country to new prime," Om Birla tweeted.

title: Starc creates world record, becomes fastest bowler to take 200 wickets in ODI history
description: Australia fast bowler Mitchell Starc has become the fastest bowler to reach 200 wickets in ODI cricket, achieving the feat against Zimbabwe in the third ODI on Saturday. The 32-year-old reached the landmark in his 102nd ODI, breaking former Pakistan spinner Saqlain Mushtaq's record (104 matches). Starc is also the fastest bowler to reach 150 ODI wickets.

title: Ranveer danced shirtless with girls for 'Jayeshbhai...', it's not a comedy: Vivek
description: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri has criticised actor Ranveer Singh over his promotions for 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar'. He said, "Ranveer went shirtless and was dancing with 25 girls during the promotions." The filmmaker further said that it's not a fashion show or comedy. "Nobody knew that the film was about female foeticide...Why would people go and see that?" he added.

title: My ex-wife and I are very much in love: Actor Gulshan Devaiah
description: Actor Gulshan Devaiah has said that he and his ex-wife, actress Kallirroi Tziafeta, are "very much in love". "We just couldn't make it (the marriage) work. But, the love is there...Marriage is a responsibility...You have to constantly be willing to negotiate with each other...and that can be hard. That's the only reason we are divorced," he added.

title: Sachin came running & hugged me, it was massive: Kaif on NatWest final
description: Discussing India's win in the 2002 NatWest final against England, Mohammad Kaif said, "It was a massive feeling to see Sachin Tendulkar receiving us. He ran towards me." "The maximum reaction...you'd get from him...was a pat on the back," he added. "I was expecting him to do that, but rather, he opened his arms up to hug me," stated Kaif.

title: Supreme Court disposed of over 1,000 cases in last 4 days: CJI Lalit
description: Chief Justice of India UU Lalit said the Supreme Court will endeavour to dispose of as many cases as possible. In the last four days, the Supreme Court has disposed of 1,293 miscellaneous matters and 106 regular hearing matters, CJI Lalit said on Friday. He added that about 440 transfer petitions were also wrapped up by the court.

title: Journalist P Sainath to return award conferred on him by Murugha Mutt in 2017
description: Journalist and Ramon Magsaysay awardee P Sainath has said that he is returning the Basavashree award and ₹5 lakh prize money that was awarded to him by Karnataka's Murugha Mutt in 2017. This comes after arrest of Mutt's head seer, Shivamurthy Murugha Sharanaru, in sexual assault case. Sainath said he is returning the award in solidarity with survivors in case.

title: Why should restaurants pay commission: NRAI on Swiggy, Zomato dine-in offers
description: National Restaurant Association of India (NRAI) asked members to "inspect the terms and conditions thoroughly and then make an informed decision" before joining Zomato and Swiggy's new dine-in programmes. The schemes offer discounts and allow customers to pay bills through apps. "Question here is why should a restaurant pay a commission...to offer a discount to its own customer?" NRAI argued.

title: Man tries to enter home on pretext of renting room, kills woman in Noida
description: Noida Police arrested a 25-year-old man on Friday after he allegedly tried to force his way into a woman's home under the pretext of renting a room and then killed her. The accused, who is unemployed, waited for everyone to leave the house before approaching the woman with the objective of robbing her, killing her in the process, police said.

title: Microsoft's combat goggles win 1st delivery approval from US Army
description: Microsoft will deliver its first batch of high-tech combat goggles to the US Army after the company received approval from Assistant Secretary for Acquisition Douglas Bush. The goggles, named  Integrated Visual Augmentation System (IVAS), will provide a heads-up display and night vision to soldiers. The Army could spend up to $21.9 billion on IVAS over the next decade.

title: I dare you to name encroachers of Bengaluru lake: Kumaraswamy to K'taka CM
description: Amid flood-like situation in parts of Bengaluru, JD(S) leader HD Kumaraswamy criticised CM Basavaraj Bommai and dared him to name the encroachers of Bengaluru lake and Rajakaluve. "Thousands of crores of rupees for the development of Rajakaluve has been taken. The CM says that money has been released. So to whom did the money go?" said Kumaraswamy.

title: Doctor starts performing C-section, stitches back Assam woman as baby was premature
description: A six-month pregnant woman in Assam is said to be critical after a doctor performing a C-section delivery stitched her cut back on realising the baby was premature. Dr AK Biswas of Karimganj Civil Hospital claimed the patient's family requested him to perform the surgery as she was in pain. A seven-member team has been formed to probe the matter.

title: MNS leaders who assaulted woman during argument in Mumbai get bail
description: A court granted bail to three leaders of Raj Thackeray's Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) who had pushed and slapped an elderly woman in Mumbai's Kamathipura. This comes a day after they were arrested as a video of the incident went viral online. Speaking against their bail, the woman appealed to the Maharashtra government to initiate action against the accused.

title: Foreign Min Lavrov not given US visa yet for UN leaders meet: Russia
description: Russia has asked for 56 visas from the US to allow Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov and his delegation to participate in the annual meeting of world leaders at the UN this month but hasn't received any. Russia's UN Ambassador Vassily Nebenzia said this was "alarming" and that the US, as the UN host country, is legally required to issue visas.
